entry.title: iwa: Allow "potentially trustworthy" IWA bundle URLs in Update Manifests
entry.content:
This allows the browser to download IWA Web Bundles even over http, as

long as the http origin is configured to be treated securely, either via

`OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOrigin` policy or

`--unsafely-treat-insecure-origin-as-secure` flag / command line switch.

entry.title: Rename components/strings/ branding strings
entry.content:
Branded string targets and generated header files were named

"*chromium_strings" and "*chromium_strings.h", respectively. This is

the result of originally having a chromium and google_chrome version of

those. After https://crrev.com/c/4703485 there's a single version, so

rename to "*branded_strings*" for consistency.



This CL performs this renaming in components/strings/.

entry.title: [iOS] Skip History Sync if optional and declined too often
entry.content:
The history sync promo should not be shown too frequently to the users.

In the flow for which history sync is optional, the opt-in screen should

be skipped if any user declined it in the past 2 weeks, or twice in a

row.



This CL adds a new HistorySyncSkipReason for History Sync flows

for this case, combined to a isOptional parameter for related

coordinators that is set for each entry point.



It also updates the EGTest utils to reset the prefs, and avoid the

skip to happen in the tests.



Bug: 1450867

Change-Id: Iec1acdd3bf6534d29ca430ff4feda04464a29aff

entry.title: Mark checking ComputeContentSize optimization expensive
entry.content:
This `DCHECK` is quite expensive, not intended to be enabled

on user machines, while still useful when making a big changes

to the inline algorithms such as adding a new property.



This patch marks it as `EXPENSIVE_DCHECKS_ARE_ON` so that it's

not enabled even when `DCHECK` is enabled.



Bug: 1362791

entry.title: [dPWA] Partition preinstalled web app configs into install, uninstall and ignore
entry.content:
This CL adds a kIgnore install decision for preinstalled web app

configs.

This is a safer version of kUninstall where the user's app install

state is left alone rather than having the app uninstalled when

configs become disabled.



There have been past bugs relating to preinstalled web apps getting

disabled and being wiped from the device, see crbug.com/1393284 and

crbug.com/1363004 for past incidents. By making uninstallation an

explicit decision for just the config parameters that need it this

reduces the severity of general config related bugs.



Bug: 1409355

Change-Id: I67ad8f48669008f7c1bfe1704958c5ababcf3538

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4833875

entry.title: [MailboxVideoFrameConverter] SetPrefersExternalSampler() on Linux
entry.content:
Linux is now ready to use MultiplanarSI for hardware video decoding. The

relevant flow occurs when Linux is using NV12 with Vulkan [1]). In that

case, it creates SharedImages via MailboxVideoFrameConverter. This CL

changes MailboxVideoFrameConverter to invoke SetPrefersExternalSampler()

on multiplanar SI formats for Linux as well as ChromeOS. This is the

only change that appears to be required to enable experimentation with

multiplanarSI for hardware video decode on Linux:



- ToVkFormat() on the SharedImage side has been updated to handle

multiplanar formats with external sampling, and all callers of

ToVkFormat() that would receive multiplanar VkFormats when using

multiplanar SI for hardware video decode are already receiving those

formats in the current flow and thus have support for them

- Other callers of SetPrefersExternalSampler() in the codebase

(VideoResourceUpdater and VideoCaptureImpl) guard it via

BUILDFLAG(IS_OZONE) and hence will transparently work with Linux



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/mojo/services/gpu_mojo_media_client_linux.cc;l=38-41;drc=064f82bf9239232b1619ca68a7487425f7cc328c



Bug: 1471111

Change-Id: Id491617564c7615359006250203ac6810871fa9e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4846829

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

entry.title: [Sync] Make incoming password sharing invitations low priority
entry.content:
This CL adds INCOMING_PASSWORD_SHARING_INVITATION data type to low

priority types. This is required to make it sure that Password data type

is initialized during the initial sync first, to prevent storing any

incoming passwords before all the other user passwords are stored

locally. This is required to prevent password overwriting during the

initial merge.



This CL also added two new integration tests to verify handling invitations during the initial sync, and that the password from Password data type is not overwritten.

entry.title: CCA: Change AsyncJobQueue.push to not return promise
entry.content:
Since most caller that use AsyncJobQueue for proper sequencing of async

operations and don't explicitly wait on the job to finish, and relies on

unhandled promise rejection for error reporting, the API is more user

friendly if we return a struct instead of a promise directly, to avoid

floating promise warning on use.



`cca.py lint --eslintrc .eslintrc_floating_promise.js` error count goes

down from 64 to 60.



Bug: b:172336355

entry.title: [AWC] Add `resizable` CSS @media feature
entry.content:
The new `resizable` CSS will enable using CSS or JS @media query to know

if the window can be resized or not. The value is a `boolean` defaulting

to `true`, as the actual value retrieval from widget is implemented in

follow-up CLs.



Usage examples:



```css

@media (resizable: false) {

/* CSS to be applied */

}

```



```js

window.matchMedia('(resizable: false)').matches

```



I2P thread

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/oCxWg8q_OQY/m/LUTw0T5cCQAJ



Public explainer is available @

https://github.com/ivansandrk/additional-windowing-controls/blob/main/awc-explainer.md



Private doc @ go/additional-windowing-controls



Bug: 1466855, b:288265319

Change-Id: I301053f4a0cc9c9c0c15c88f6fea98f9b52ab405

entry.title: Fix extension caching for very long account ids
entry.content:
If an account id was longer than 255 characters installing extensions

was broken since this would attempt to create a folder with a name

longer than the file system supports.



Since we simply use a full URL as account id for PWA kiosk apps,

we hit this limit if the URL is long enough.



Fixed: b/299345973

Tests: Manually verified it works

entry.title: [text-autospace] Use a flag in `ShapeResult` to handle line breaking
entry.content:
This patch implements a new way to remove auto-spacing at the

line breaking points.



crrev.com/c/4826308 implemented it by making the glyphs as

unsafe-to-break. This turned out to be not great for:

1. Reshaping can remove auto-spacing at the line-end, but it

also removes auto-spacing of the first character in the

wrapped line.

2. The performance hit of reshaping turned out to be more than

expected.



This patch undoes crrev.com/c/4826308, and adds a flag to

`ShapeResultCharacterData`. While `HarfBuzzRunGlyphData`

doesn't have spare bits, `ShapeResultCharacterData` has spare

bits, and the auto-spacing is per character, not per glyph.



Bug: 1463890

Change-Id: I1dee11f114e94872806e77e78f9d1d66f5a8e133

entry.title: [AutofillDataModel] Moves legacy classes into i18n hierarchies.
entry.content:
As part of the autofill i18n project, the legacy hierarchy will be

served via the i18n API by dynamically building the hierarchy.



To reach that goal this CL updates the current legacy classes, which

now support a more dynamic way of registering children. To accomplish

this we have merged the `I18nAddressComponent` into

`AddressComponent`, hence importing the same way of creating nodes.



When creating the dynamic hierarchy, each field type is now mapped to

an instance of the corresponding class. Note that this means that if

the field type trees are equivalent then the legacy hierarchy matches

fully.



Bug: 1464568

entry.title: Privacy Sandbox: Fix intersectionRatio check in PS dialog
entry.content:
Privacy Sandbox dialog "Show more" logic relies on an

IntersectionObserver reporting the intersection ratio between the last

text element and its container. The intersectionRatio is supposed to be

equal to 1 when the last element is completely visible: in that case we

know the bottom of the page was reached and the show button can be

hidden. Sometimes intersectionRatio value is reported as 0.99 making

the logic fail: the "More" button stays visible and its overlay is

covering the action buttons. This CL changes the intersectionRatio check

and makes is less strict, waiting for crbug.com/1020466 to be fixed.



Bug: 1482215, b/299120185

entry.title: Roll libc++ from 84fb809dd6da to 68a6f0b88287 (352 revisions)
entry.content:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/llvm/llvm-project/libcxx.git/+log/84fb809dd6da..68a6f0b88287



This brings in a change that changes how libc++'s assertion mode

works. Instead of _LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS there's now

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_SAFE_MODE and _LIBCPP_ENABLE_HARDENED_MODE.

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_HARDENED_MODE only has security checks.

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_SAFE_MODE is virtually identical to

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS at the moment, but upstream

wants to remove some asserts from it in the future.

So we'll have to keep an eye on that and make sure none we want

get dropped. https://crbug.com/1465186 has more details.



(This here doesn't update the pnacl-saigo libc++ version, so

that still uses the old _LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS mode.)



The update also deprecates basic_string. For now

that's behind an

`if !defined(_LIBCPP_CHAR_TRAITS_REMOVE_BASE_SPECIALIZATION)`

but it will be removed in the future. So we'll also have to

remove the uses of that (there aren't that many, but one is

in jnipp which is used by openexr, so that'll take some time

to update), and then define

`_LIBCPP_CHAR_TRAITS_REMOVE_BASE_SPECIALIZATION`. This is

https://1481891.



So there's some follow-up to do after this rolls in.

Missing CPE base address for third_party/dbus/3pp/3pp.pb is added by PEEPs Security's CPESuggest tool. This tool uses TPMonster's CPESuggest service that relies on external data and confidence.



Adding CPE fixes to a README.chromium file is recommended practice [1] to enable automated vulnerability monitoring. For more information on how CPE prefixes are used see the Chromium Third Party docs [2].

[2] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/adding_to_third_party.md#add-a-readme_chromium

entry.title: GWP-ASan: Add feature map
entry.content:
We intend to expand the GWP-ASan Android experiment to include WebView.

WebView experiments must add a flag to

`ProductionSupportedFlagList.java`. To do so, we need to expose the two

GWP-ASan `base::Feature`s to Java. This CL plumbs together the

boilerplate to do so.

`android_accessing_cpp_features_in_java.md`.

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Initialize WaylandBufferManagerGpu with bug fix ids
entry.content:
This CL lets WaylandBufferManagerConnector initialize

WaylandBufferManagerGpu with bug fix ids.



Bug fix ids are sent from the server asynchronously and stored in

zaura_shell, so it needs to wait until all bug fix ids are sent. We can

confirm all bug fix ids are sent by receiving `bug_fix_done` event.

entry.title: Revert "Fix and re-enable the calendar ResetToTodayWithAnimation test"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 32c7516a5b9fa0f41e84967f570a373b15dcb567.



Reason for revert: The test is still flaky. See crbug.com/1482615



Original change's description:

> Fix and re-enable the calendar ResetToTodayWithAnimation test

>

> There are a lot of nested animations (one animation starts on another

> animation's OnAnimationComplete) in the calendar animations. So

> the `FastForwardBy` method dose not always work as expected in the

> test runtime.

>

> This cl uses `ui::LayerAnimationStoppedWaiter` instead of

> `task_environment()->FastForwardBy` in this animation test to make sure

> an animation is finished.

>

> Bug: b/252308184

> Change-Id: Ia089a41244dff6c1f8e2f535c24ce65bf5e6e59e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4862733

> Commit-Queue: Jiaming Cheng

> Reviewed-by: Ahmed Mehfooz

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1196323}

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Set PromiseStatus to kInstalling during progress change
entry.content:
ARC has recently started setting install sessions to "active" despite

not having obvious installation updates/ progression. To fix this, set

promise app status to kInstalling during progress changes, instead

of when the session becomes active. However, when a session switches

from active to inactive, this should still set the promise app status

back to kPending.

entry.title: Use color provider for touch selection magnifier border and shadows.
entry.content:
Make TouchSelectionMagnifierAura a NativeThemeObserver so that it

updates its border and shadow colors according to the native theme color

provider.

window/widget instead of using the native theme. But, this doesn't seem

too easy at the moment so the native theme should be good enough for

now.)

entry.title: Inline touch selection magnifier background offset computation.
entry.content:
The helper GetZoomLayerBackgroundOffset just gets the offset between

zoom_layer_center and magnifier_source_center. Probably simpler to just

inline this in the one place it is used. (This makes it slightly simpler

to experiment with different zoom layer sizes, since the zoom layer

bounds won't need to be passed around to get the offset.)

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroup ] Fix drop indicator bug / Fix separator bug
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the drop indicator would not be visible when attempting to drag a group to the end of the container when there was 4 or less buttons present. This is done by reserving 8px in SavedTabGroupBar so the drop indicator has room to paint. To account for this, the BookmarkBar is losing 8px, specifically on the SavedTabGroup separator.



Fixes a bug where the separator between the SavedTabGroupBar section and BookmarksBar section would not appear when the browser was resized to a smaller size.

entry.title: Minor fix for independent damage on quads sharing quad state
entry.content:
Surface damage in Exo is separated into each texture quad via the

'per_quad_damage' feature. However these quads can all completely

overlay and therefor can share a single 'shared_quad_state'.

Surface aggregator did not expect to have 'per_quad_damage' for a

quad that also shared the same sqs. This minor fix allows for that

condition and appends this additional independent damage to the

'surface_damage_rect_list'.

entry.title: Reland "Add phone hub onboarding eligible condition"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 596cfbd219f9e068bcc405256b2576daff758c2c.



Reason for revert: Reland with a fix.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Add phone hub onboarding eligible condition"

>

> This reverts commit e2c22655beda26aaa902ef1aaa9560a7857d7d4e.

>

> Reason for revert: failing on:

>

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/34119/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

>

> 2023-09-12T23:08:42.747041Z FATAL browser_tests[325873:325873]: [scalable_iph_browser_test_base.cc(114)] Check failed: !mock_delegate_. Mocks have already been set up.

> [...]

> #6 0x55e25ba19703 ash::ScalableIphBrowserTestBase::SetUpMocks()

> #7 0x55e25ba19661 ash::ScalableIphBrowserTestBase::SetUpOnMainThread()

> #8 0x55e2699e883b content::BrowserTestBase::ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop()

> [...]

>

> Original change's description:

> > Add phone hub onboarding eligible condition

> >

> > - This CL adds x_CustomConditionPhoneHubOnboardingEligible. The

> > condition is true if feature status of Phone Hub is either

> > kEligiblePhoneButNotSetUp or kDisabled.

> > - This adds a dependency from ScalableIph to PhoneHubManager.

> > PhoneHubManager is expected to be initialized at a specific timing.

> > This CL makes sure that ScalableIph is initialized after

> > PhoneHubManager.

> > - This CL fixes an issue with our OOBE flow test in our browser tests.

> > - To fix the browser test, we had to change behavior of

> > LoggedInUserMixin. Previously LoggedInUserMixin has configured

> > LoginManagerMixin to skip post login screens by default. This CL

> > makes it optional.

> > - familiy_user_device_metrics_browsertest.cc was depending on the

> > default behavior. This CL updates the test.

> >

> > Bug: b:295369951

> > Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*ScalableIph*

> > Change-Id: I361169d5ca7d531ed26f16cd94b3247be6edb94d

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4845174

entry.title: Remove redundant checks for AnchorElementMetricsSender availability
entry.content:
Call sites which lookup an AnchorElementMetricsSender first check whether

a given document may have the sender before calling the lookup method,

but the lookup method also does the availability check.



As observed in issue 1481259, one of these call sites is on a hot path.

So even though the check is no longer individually expensive, the

redundant checks would still have a measurable effect.



Bug: 1481259

entry.title: Highlight the current sentence.
entry.content:
This includes fading out what's already been read and brightly

highlighting the current sentence. I needed to go by tree node because

we need access to the node to add spans for highlighting. This makes the

speech very choppy on places like Wikipedia that has lots of links

everywhere (since each link is a separate node), but I put a TODO to

investigate how to make that better. The highlight itself also only

highlights the single node even if it's less than a sentence. But it's a

good start.

entry.title: [Element Capture #5] fix coordinate system issues
entry.content:
This Patch:



This patch fixes several related issues caused by mismatches

in coordinate systems, of which capture is concerned with several:



A: the compositor frame or root render pass coordinate system



This coordinate system is rooted at 0,0 and has a size of frame_size.



B: the captured render pass coordinate system



When we are not capturing the root render pass, this coordinate

system is independent, and linked to A through the use of a transform.



C: the root aura::Window coordinate system



For ChromeOS window capture, this is the same as A. For tab capture, this is the coordinate system of the entire Chrome browser.



D: the aura::Window under capture coordinate system



This is used by the mouse cursor overlay to determine where the cursor is drawn. Calculation on all platforms is done by taking the coordinates from the operating system in the reference space of a targeted window and then normalizing the location to be mapped to B.



E: the operating system mouse cursor location coordinate system



This gets transformed to a normalized vector and inputted into the overlay calculations.



F: the output video frame coordinate system



The captured video frame has its own coordinate system, which accounts for things like letterboxing and scaling.



Resolved Issues:



1. The mouse cursor position is drawn incorrectly. This is resolved by ensuring that the normalized bounds from E get properly translated into the output video frame system F.



2. Elements that have a render pass with negative bounds do not get captured at all. This is resolved by properly translating the coordinated from system B to system A when necessary, and no longer assuming that the render pass is rooted at 0, 0.



The Project:

For more information, Googlers may visit: go/element-capture



All developers are welcome to visit the W3 spec page at:

https://screen-share.github.io/element-capture/



Coming Up Next:

* Bug fixing and stabilizations.

* Working with eladlon@ to replace the hack with the proper

restrictTo API.

entry.title: Add platform_max_decoded_bytes to the input arguments of ImageDecoder::Create()
entry.content:
There is a plan to move image-decoders to components/.



ImageDecoder CalculateMaxDecodedBytes() needs the MaxDecodedImageBytes

information from platform. In order to separate the ImageDecoder

component BUILD from the platform BUILD, the platform code will be

moved outside of ImageDecoder. The caller of ImageDecoder::Create()

needs to get the info from Platform::Current()->MaxDecodedImageBytes()

and pass it in.

entry.title: Fix window enumeration/offline integration tests to match/wait correctly
entry.content:
Fixed:

* The offline install test case now takes into account the new Installer

API behavior that successful interactive installs show a progress UI,

but once the install completes, the `InstallerSuccessLaunchCmdLine` is

launched and the UI closes automatically.

* The offline install test case now robustly handles waiting for the

unsuccessful interactive install error dialog.

* `CloseInstallCompleteDialog` was not waiting for a match, resulting

in incorrect semantics.

* `CloseInstallCompleteDialog` now exits early if a match was found.

* `WindowEnumerator` stops enumeration early if a match was found.

* Removed the need to call `::WaitForInputIdle` in `Run`.



The `mac-updater-try-builder-rel` and the `mac-updater-try-builder-dbg`

bots have been in a `shard #0 expired, not enough capacity` state for

almost 6 hours now. My change is Windows only, so I'm bypassing these

bots with `No-Try: true`



No-Try: true

entry.title: Add InstallableCriteria to InstallableEvaluator
entry.content:
This is to support universal install (install any site) - when a field

that is required for install is not provided by manifest, we fallback

to use web page metadata.

This CL adds an enum to the InstallableEvaluator's check, and update

the |CheckManifestValid| to either 1) not run, 2) check valid manifest

same as before, 3) check if the fallback value is available.
